title: Senior Software Engineer - C#/.NET & C/C++ (Windows Ecosystem) (fully remote)
description:
CloudLinux is a global remote-first company. We are driven by our principles: do the right thing, employees first, we are remote first, and we deliver high volume, low-cost Linux infrastructure and security products that help companies to increase the efficiency of their operations. Every person on our team supports each other and does what we can to ensure we all are successful. 

TuxCare is a subsidiary of CloudLinux. It offers a portfolio of security solutions for Linux and open-source software aimed at enterprise organizations. With TuxCare, enterprises can automate live vulnerability patching, minimize downtime, keep their applications secure and compliant, and get support from a team that knows Linux security best – covering the most popular Linux distributions, end-of-life systems, programming languages, and much more.

Endless Lifecycle Support (ELS) enables organizations to continue securely using Linux distributions and software languages that have reached the end of life or no longer receive standard security support – delivering vulnerability patches for unsupported versions of CentOS, CentOS Stream, Ubuntu, Debian, Oracle Linux, PHP, Python, and Spring software development framework.

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our team and contribute to the development and maintenance of our Windows-based projects. In this role, you will be responsible for building, modifying, and maintaining .NET (C#/.NET) applications on Windows, ensuring their stability and performance. You will also have the opportunity to work with and support various open-source C/C++ projects, adapting them for the Windows environment and enhancing their compatibility.

For more information, visit our website: https://tuxcare.com/extended-lifecycle-support/

Key Responsibilities:

In this role, you will be responsible for a variety of tasks critical to ensuring the stability, performance, and adaptability of our projects within the Windows environment. Your primary responsibilities will include:

1. Build, modify, and maintain .NET on Windows

  • Make changes and extensions, maintain .NET (C#/.NET) on Windows. Modify .NET and C/C++ codebases to ensure stable operation on Windows.
  • Possess a deep understanding of the Windows infrastructure (especially system components and the build process).
  • Be able to work with various build approaches: MSBuild/Visual Studio as well as alternative tools (MinGW, Cygwin). Set up build automation (CI/CD) for various Windows environments (including MSBuild, MinGW, Cygwin, etc.).

2. Build and support various open-source C/C++ projects on Windows

  • Maintain, fix bugs, and adapt them for Windows.
  • Handle project builds with an awareness of dependencies and environment differences (especially when Windows support is limited).
  • Maintain and develop or port existing build scripts (PowerShell/Bash/Batch, etc.).
  • Investigate, fix, and track issues encountered during building or running open-source projects.
  • Work with version control systems (Git), participate in code reviews, and handle pull/merge requests.

Requirements

To thrive in this role, we are looking for a specialist who has:

  • Solid knowledge of C# and the .NET infrastructure (especially on Windows).
  • Good C/C++ skills with experience building under Windows (Visual Studio, MinGW, Cygwin).
  • Strong understanding of the Windows environment: system libraries, compilers, loaders, and compatibility nuances.
  • Experience with version control systems (Git).
  • Ability to handle dependencies, adjust build scripts, and resolve compatibility issues.
  • Skills in reading and analyzing open-source code.
  • Familiarity with PowerShell and automation of build/deployment processes.

It would be great if you also have:

  • Experience in setting up and running CI/CD (GitLab, Jenkins, or similar) for Windows projects.
  • Understanding cross-platform builds (Linux/Windows) and experience working with package managers (vcpkg, NuGet, Conan, etc.).
  • Experience interacting with open-source communities, contributing pull requests, and engaging in discussions.

Benefits

What's in it for you?

  • A focus on professional development.
  • Interesting and challenging projects.
  • Fully remote work with flexible working hours, that allows you to schedule your day and work from any location worldwide.
  • Paid 24 days of vacation per year, 10 days of national holidays, and unlimited sick leaves.
  • Compensation for private medical insurance.
  • Co-working and gym/sports reimbursement.
  • Budget for education.
  • The opportunity to receive a reward for the most innovative idea that the company can patent.



By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal data as described in our Privacy Policy (https://cloudlinux.com/candidate-privacy-notice), which provides detailed information on how we maintain and handle your data.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Crypto
Sr. iOS Engineer -  Cashalo/Empower, Asia Pacific (Remote)
description:
EMPOWER OVERVIEW

Empower is shaking up an outdated financial system by providing real opportunity for our customers: the opportunity to get the cash they need, to access fair credit, and to change their financial story. Today, we’re helping millions of people find financial security through machine learning models that evaluate creditworthiness using a more inclusive lens and mobile-first products: Cash Advance, Thrive line of credit, and Petal credit cards. Tomorrow? Creating even more financial paths for our customers (and their wallets) to succeed.

This year, Empower ranked #65 on Inc. 5000’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies list — our third year in a row cracking the top 100 — and was named by Forbes as one of the 25 Next Billion-Dollar Startups for 2024. Empower was also featured by Forbes on America’s Best Startup Employers list in 2023, and our Thrive line of credit product was named by Fast Company as one of 2022’s Next Big Things in Tech.

Empower is backed by Sequoia Capital, Blisce, and Icon Ventures. Ready to grow your impact and accelerate your career? Take a look at our open roles — we can’t wait to meet you.

THE EMPOWER WAY

Great Expectations: We come up with bold, audacious goals for ourselves and go all out for impact

Owner Mindset: We give every employee latitude to act independently, make smart choices, and move the business forward

Spirited Debate: We love skeptics and seek counter opinions to challenge our personal assumptions and expand our view

Customer Obsession: We listen to understand, empathize, and create a memorable, rewarding experience for our community

Inclusive Collaboration: We believe diverse teams make the best decisions, and we strive to give diverse voices a seat at the table

No Jerks Allowed: We value our relationships and take the time to build trust and connection and communicate respectfully

WHAT EMPOWER OFFERS

Competitive salary

Generous equity package

Full healthcare benefits

Technology expense reimbursement

Virtual first environment

JOB DESCRIPTION

As an iOS Software Engineer, you’ll create the iOS mobile app that powers the Empower customer experience. You’ll engage with a collaborative, high powered team to develop solutions and lead product engineering on projects with a reach of millions. The solutions you’ll build will be robust, secure and easy to understand both for our users and your engineering peers. You’ll take end to end ownership of new features and product lines shaping work in early stages, building, deploying and running post deployment analysis to ensure we’re hitting our goals.

Travel for company offsites is expected at a minimum 2 times a year.

Key Responsibilities

  • Designing and building iOS mobile apps

  • Contribution and adherence to software engineering standards and practices

  • Implementing secure coding standards in accordance with the Empower Secure Development Policy

  • Perform on-going security testing and code review to improve software security

  • Meeting sprint goals

  • Leading and/or supporting feature specification activities (Product Engineering)

  • Monitoring the performance of the Empower mobile app and applying corrective action through bug fixing and general improvement.

  • Minimizing defects and improving reliability through: Development of automated tests, manual test validation, development of fit for purpose architecture and code, contributing to PRs

  • Developing and maintaining the iOS app build pipeline

  • Publishing the App to the App Store

  • Collaborating cross-functionally to define, design and ship new features that create customer and business value.

  • Playing an active role in advising and collaborating with design and product to flesh out the specifications of each epic.

  • Writing engineering specs, including acceptance criteria and server contracts

  • Grooming stories for upcoming sprints

  • Maximising effective development and identifying new technology opportunities by: Keeping across iOS development announcements, being across community best practice, discovering and evaluating new technologies

Candidate Qualifications

  • Bachelor degree or greater within Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related subject

  • 5+ years developing consumer facing iOS apps

  • Working experience in Swift and iOS UI Frameworks

At Empower, we hire for people that push themselves to understand others and seek out ways to challenge their personal assumptions. Our hope is that by fostering such an environment, we strengthen our business and relationships by putting people first. We are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workspace where everyone (regardless of age, education, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or any personal characteristics) feels like they belong. Even if your experience doesn’t exactly match up to our job description, you should feel empowered to apply regardless!

title: Senior/Staff Product Manager, Omni-Channel/Branch
description:
About the Role

Clutch is on a mission to transform Credit Unions into FinTechs, making them their members’ first choice.

Branches have been the cornerstone of banking for decades. As credit unions undergo digital transformation, they need a connected omnichannel experience to deliver a best-in-class service to their members—“meeting them where they are.”

Clutch began by revolutionizing the digital experience to drive loan growth and automation. We’ve now expanded to an omnichannel solution for branches and call centers. This new product is in its early stages, focused on achieving product-market fit. Your role will be pivotal in bringing Clutch’s cutting-edge technology to physical branches and call centers, saving Credit Union members over 200,000 hours annually while creating intuitive, employee-focused tools that rival the best consumer products.

We’re seeking a super-IC with exceptional B2B experience to rapidly onboard and lead this product. If you excel in ambiguous environments, can drive strong product direction with urgency and momentum, and thrive in discovery-heavy roles, this is your opportunity.

Our ideal candidate:

  • Brings strong B2B experience and an exceptional “customer hand.”

  • Can be onsite at customers every other week for discovery and adoption.

  • Thrives in fast-evolving, high-impact environments.

About the Team

Clutch is a product-minded company with a culture of innovation, curiosity, and relentless customer focus. Our Product team tackles ambiguity with confidence, driving a connected, multi-product ecosystem that delivers outcomes.

We foster a fast-paced, collaborative environment where initiative and adaptability are celebrated. Self-starters thrive at Clutch, elevating their teams and the organization daily.

Joining Product team at Clutch means working with a high-caliber team of alumni from institutions like Harvard, Stanford, Wharton, and Princeton. Our team brings deep experience in founding startups, launching new bets, and scaling products at growth-stage companies.

What You'll Do

Within 3 months, you will:

  • Rapidly onboard and master Clutch’s products, processes, and customer landscape.

  • Take ownership of in-flight product initiatives, driving pace and momentum in a fast-evolving fintech environment.

  • Collaborate with three innovation partners to lead the design partnership program, delivering strong product direction.

  • Visit credit union branches every two weeks to gather feedback from employees, iterating the product toward product-market fit.

  • Partner with Sales and Customer Success to craft a GTM strategy, including early demos, product positioning, pricing, and launch plans for a connected product ecosystem.

  • Iterate on the product to achieve monetization goals for the year.

Within 6 months, you will:

  • Enable the Sales team to effectively sell the product and meet annual monetization goals.

  • Launch strategic, cross-channel features that enhance lending and account opening for branches and call centers.

  • Establish yourself as a trusted partner across Engineering, Customer Success, and Sales.

Within 9 months, you will:

  • Lay the foundation for scaling the product to meet growing demand.

  • Partner with Implementation Engineering to develop a plan for 50+ deployments, ensuring smooth scaling and adoption.

What You'll Bring

Ownership and a bar-raiser mindset, along with:

  • Proven experience navigating high ambiguity in mid-stage, scaling B2B environments.

  • Exceptional organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize, negotiate, and drive outcomes with internal and external stakeholders.

  • Customer-first mindset and the ability to act as a solutions specialist, Customer Success Manager, or Implementation Engineer during early product stages while leveraging organizational support.

  • Clear, concise, and compelling communication skills, with the ability to influence technical and non-technical audiences at all levels.

  • A bias for action: the ability to set pace and momentum, driving rapid delivery without compromising on quality or team well-being.

  • Strategic thinking and product chops, with a track record of iterating toward product-market fit.

  • Nice to have: Experience in fintech or lending

Please note that this role may evolve as our business needs change, so we appreciate your flexibility and adaptability.

What's In It For You?

  • Remote Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom of remote work from anywhere, balancing life and career seamlessly.

  • Unforgettable Off-Sites: Twice a year, bond with colleagues in exciting destinations, fostering teamwork and fresh ideas.

  • Paid Time Off: Enjoy flexible PTO days yearly for relaxation and rejuvenation.

  • Stock Options: Joining us means having a stake in our success, so you'll receive stock options as part of your compensation package.

  • Home Office Setup: Create your ideal workspace with a dedicated budget for home office essentials.

  • Work Trip Budget: Grow personally and professionally with a budget for work-related trips and co-working.

  • Health Coverage: Prioritize your well-being with comprehensive health and dental insurance plans.

About Us

Clutch is a revolutionary vertical SaaS company, proudly backed by Andreessen Horowitz (A16z), aimed at revolutionizing the way Credit Unions engage and change the lives of their members. title: Senior iOS Engineer
description:
An Introduction to Primer

The 21st century has witnessed remarkable expansion within the payments ecosystem with the introduction of new payment services, growth in cross-border commerce, and the development of multi-payment processor payment strategies.

The bottom line is that payment is no longer just another step in the purchasing funnel but a strategic asset that can drive business growth and innovation.

Enter Primer - the world's first unified payment infrastructure, empowering businesses worldwide to unleash their payment potential. By choosing our platform, merchants can take control over their payment stack, create unique commerce experiences, accelerate their roadmap and increase payment success.

Primer's enterprise-grade infrastructure, frameworks, and tooling allow merchants to unify their disparate payment solutions and services to build optimised payment flows tailored to their unique business needs with no code or additional complexity. We strive to make something complex incredibly simple and intuitive.

Our success so far has been reflected in the trust placed in us by category leaders such as Printify, NewLook, Voi, and Dabble, who are using Primer to transform their payments into a growth lever. Moreover, the world's top investors, including Accel, Balderton, Iconiq, and Tencent, have also invested in Primer's vision to rebuild payments and commerce from the ground up.

Join us in shaping the future of payments and commerce. Let's pave the way for a world where businesses can fully realise their payment potential.

What will the role involve?

  • Creating the best checkout experience in the world! Rethinking how merchants integrate payments, and how customers are paying online

  • Designing, implementing and maintaining fully-tested and highly-optimised libraries

  • Creating first-class documentation for both merchants and internal teams

  • Working closely with users to analyse feedback and improve our products and services with each iteration

  • Making decisions on technology, building for scale and reach

  • Conducting code reviews and mentoring juniors in future as we grow the team

  • Maintaining the SDK

  • Working closely with a cross-functional team of front end engineers, back end engineers, mobile engineers, designers and product

What are we looking for?

  • Someone pragmatic and versatile, who will use the best tools to build out the product

  • Extensive experience in building, maintaining and documenting developer libraries

  • Relevant experience with iOS - any experience with React Native is also interesting!

  • Passion for maintainable, performant, well-tested and resilient code

  • Appreciation for the Developer Experience we'll be creating

  • Excellent communication skills, able to collaborate in a cross-functional team

  • Curiosity and interest to learn!

  • It would be amazing to speak to people with previous experience of JavaScript UI optimisation; accessibility best practices; and online payments and APMs

    Our engineering teams work fully remotely across Europe and operate within local timezones - if you are not based in the above countries listed but would still like to apply please let us know in your application

    Unfortunately we are unable to offer VISA sponsorships or relocation packages at this time

What’s the culture like at Primer?

We’re building a culture where people can come and do their best work and enjoy it. We want our people to be proud of the impact that they have at Primer, and of the work that they are doing. You will be working with a team of people who are mission-driven, smart, and reflective, and who are invested in building exceptional products and delivering success for our merchants (and we also know how to have fun along the way).

We work remotely. We believe that building a successful, profitable company goes beyond proximity. We invest in our relationships with each other through great remote working practices and thoughtfully designed face-to-face time together. Our heads-together time comes in the form of workstations, our annual company retreat, and co-working space access worldwide.

Finally, let’s go ahead and say it. The work that we do is challenging. Startups are a challenge, building category defining products is a challenge. You should be prepared for a challenge at Primer. But, there’s a big difference between a challenge and a struggle. The key difference is that the right challenge comes with the right support structures, an acceptance that not everything always goes to plan, a collaborative environment, and a great team around you. It’s never a challenge that you will face alone.

Our benefits:

  • We are fully remote

  • Competitive share options

  • Uncapped holiday, with 25 days minimum to be taken

  • Co-working space access

  • Workations & company retreat

  • The best equipment for your role

  • £500 towards your home office setup

  • Generous learning budget

  • Medical insurance

  • A broad set of additional perks and benefits (depending on location)

Don’t meet every single requirement?

At Primer, we’re dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply. You may be the right candidate for this or other roles. Primer is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees, regardless of background or beliefs—see our diversity commitment statement for more details

Equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging policy

Primer adopts a zero-tolerance approach to discrimination.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities to all current and prospective employees regardless of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership.

title: Senior BI Analyst - Cashalo
description:
EMPOWER OVERVIEW

Empower is shaking up an outdated financial system by providing real opportunity for our customers: the opportunity to get the cash they need, to access fair credit, and to change their financial story. Today, we’re helping millions of people find financial security through machine learning models that evaluate creditworthiness using a more inclusive lens and mobile-first products: Cash Advance, Thrive line of credit, and Petal credit cards. Tomorrow? Creating even more financial paths for our customers (and their wallets) to succeed.

This year, Empower ranked #65 on Inc. 5000’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies list — our third year in a row cracking the top 100 — and was named by Forbes as one of the 25 Next Billion-Dollar Startups for 2024. Empower was also featured by Forbes on America’s Best Startup Employers list in 2023, and our Thrive line of credit product was named by Fast Company as one of 2022’s Next Big Things in Tech.

Empower is backed by Sequoia Capital, Blisce, and Icon Ventures. Ready to grow your impact and accelerate your career? Take a look at our open roles — we can’t wait to meet you.

THE EMPOWER WAY

Great Expectations: We come up with bold, audacious goals for ourselves and go all out for impact

Owner Mindset: We give every employee latitude to act independently, make smart choices, and move the business forward

Spirited Debate: We love skeptics and seek counter opinions to challenge our personal assumptions and expand our view

Customer Obsession: We listen to understand, empathize, and create a memorable, rewarding experience for our community

Inclusive Collaboration: We believe diverse teams make the best decisions, and we strive to give diverse voices a seat at the table

No Jerks Allowed: We value our relationships and take the time to build trust and connection and communicate respectfully

WHAT EMPOWER OFFERS

Competitive salary

Generous equity package

Full healthcare benefits

Technology expense reimbursement

Virtual first environment

Cashalo OVERVIEW

Empower is a fast-growing fintech on a mission to expand access to fair credit to give anyone the opportunity to improve their financial security and mobility. We recently launched in Southeast Asia through our acquisition of Cashalo, a leading online lending platform, and the fastest growing lender in the Philippines. Our mission to expand access to credit in the region will take creativity, passion, and drive.

Job Description

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst builds data models, reports, analysis, and tools to help Empower manage our lending operations at scale.  The role works closely with our Southeast Asia based Cashalo team and other stakeholders to develop accurate, performant, and easy to understand data models that describe our business .  You’ll develop accurate and timely datasets and loantapes for use internally and by our partners.  You’ll work with both the US based BI team and Cashalo team to expand our suite of analytics tables, validate for accuracy, and troubleshoot issues.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop accurate, responsive, and easy to understand dbt models that drive quality decision making across our Cashalo operations. 

  • Discover issues, edge cases, outliers and anomalies in our lending data.  Develop exception reporting and outlier analysis to highlight findings.

  • Extend and adapt dbt models based on business needs.  Troubleshoot and resolve issues with data and models.

  • Coordinate with internal and external teams on changes to existing reporting and implement.

  • Expand documentation and guides around BI data models.

  • Act as a SQL and Tableau resource for analysts across the organization.

  • Collaborate with the US based BI team for consistency and best practices.

title: Strategic Account Manager (Post-Sales)
description:
Who we are:

We are a leader in fraud prevention and AML compliance. Our platform uses device intelligence, behavior biometrics, machine learning, and AI to stop fraud before it happens. Today, over 300 banks, retailers, and fintechs worldwide use Sardine to stop identity fraud, payment fraud, account takeovers, and social engineering scams. We have raised $75M from world-class investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Visa, Experian, FIS, and Google Ventures.

Our culture:

  • We have hubs in the Bay Area, NYC, Austin, and Toronto. However, we maintain a remote-first work culture. #WorkFromAnywhere

  • We hire talented, self-motivated individuals with extreme ownership and high growth orientation.

  • We value performance and not hours worked. We believe you shouldn't have to miss your family dinner, your kid's school play, friends get-together, or doctor's appointments for the sake of adhering to an arbitrary work schedule.

Location:

  • US or Canada (East Coast Preferred) - Remote

  • From Home / Beach / Mountain / Cafe / Anywhere!

  • We are a remote-first company with a globally distributed team. So you can find your productive zone and work from there.

About the Role:

Sardine is rapidly acquiring new customers and executing on an ambitious roadmap. As a result, we're building a world-class customer success team to support our fraud, payments, and compliance-related products as we grow. This role is a combination of Account Manager and Solution Architect. You'll manage a handful of customers and act as their stakeholder within Sardine, helping maximize the value of our products and services. In addition, you will collaborate daily with Sardine teams to help customers meet their risk, fraud, compliance, and payment needs, including risk analytics, data science, integrations, and products.  

You will:

  • Be the primary point of contact for our customers, attending to day-to-day and 'big picture' problems and opportunities and helping maximize the customer's ROI in Sardine

  • Build a thorough understanding of our product, technology, and strategy and be able to message these succinctly to customers.

  • Translate complex product and technology problems into simple and actionable solutions. Be able to manage the solution process both internally and externally.

  • Speak knowledgeably and advise on best practices relating to fraud and compliance

  • Build, monitor, and communicate KPIs to clients.

  • Provide strategic analysis and critical thinking as we plan long-term expansion.

  • Work with Sardine's risk analytics teams to proactively solve new fraud typologies and actively communicate findings to customers.


You are an ideal candidate if:

  • You've 7+ years of experience in Account Management, Customer Success, Risk Management, or Solutions Architecture within B2B SaaS, with an understanding of how customers integrate API's

  • You've domain experience in compliance, fintech, or AML/KYC

  • Your analytical skills are second to none; you excel at number crunching and drawing insights

  • You are proficient in using business intelligence tools

  • You're capable of translating complex strategies into actionable processes and outcomes

  • You're a natural at building relationships and collaborating with others

  • You've got strong presentation skills for both virtual and in-person meetings with various stakeholders

  • You've previous customer-facing experience, preferably with a technical product

  • You're an exceptional project manager, synthesizing all inputs and balancing the needs of multiple stakeholders

  • You constantly think about ways to improve processes

  • You love making customers more efficient as much as we do!

Compensation: Base pay range of $150,000 - $180,000 + equity with tremendous upside potential + Attractive benefits

Benefits we offer:

  • Generous compensation in cash and equity

  • Early exercise for all options, including pre-vested

  • Work from anywhere: Remote-first Culture

  • Flexible paid time off, Year-end break, Self care days off

  • Health insurance, dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents - US and Canada specific

  • 4% matching in 401k / RRSP - US and Canada specific

  • MacBook Pro delivered to your door

  • One-time stipend to set up a home office — desk, chair, screen, etc.

  • Monthly meal stipend

  • Monthly social meet-up stipend

  • Annual health and wellness stipend

  • Annual Learning stipend

  • Unlimited access to an expert financial advisory

Join a fast-growing company with world-class professionals from around the world. If you are seeking a meaningful career, you found the right place, and we would love to hear from you.

title: Senior Manager, Data Science & Analytics
description:
At BioRender, we are accelerating the world’s ability to discover, learn, and communicate science faster through visuals. Today, BioRender empowers millions of scientists to create beautiful, accurate biological figures for communication within pharma companies and academic research.

Our vision is to make BioRender the place where humans read biology—translating human and AI-generated data into scientifically accurate, human-understandable visuals. As AI automates large parts of research, BioRender will transform complex data, experimental results, and text inputs into clear, intuitive visuals that scientists, decision-makers, and broader audiences can quickly interpret. Visual communication will be critical to accelerating breakthroughs across academia and industry, and BioRender will bridge the gap between specialized knowledge domains.

Our Data Team is at the forefront of this vision, ensuring data is structured, trusted, and actionable for strategic decision-making. We’re looking for a Senior Manager, Data Science & Analytics who is excited to drive business impact across BioRender.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who:

  • Has previously led a Data Science & Analytics team and wants to bring their expertise to a high-growth environment where data-driven decision-making is core to the company’s success.
    OR

  • Has broad data strategy and analytics leadership experience, is comfortable managing a team, and is ready to scale a data program.

What you'll be doing :

  • Data as a Work Product

    • Unify and expand business metrics to ensure consistent usage across the company.

    • Own the trust and quality of core data sets, providing a single source of truth for company and product performance.

    • Ensure our business model is accurately reflected in how data and metrics are structured.

    Data as a Thought Leader

    • Identify emerging trends in data to guide strategic business decisions and investment areas.

    • Provide novel insights into opportunities where the company should focus its efforts.

    AI-Forward & Self-Serve Analytics

    • Enable self-serve capabilities for stakeholders across the company, reducing the technical complexity required to extract insights from data.

    • Champion AI-driven data tooling to enhance accessibility and efficiency.

Our ideal fit brings:

  • Strong business acumen with a deep understanding of key GTM, Finance, and Product metrics.

  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

  • Experience in training and enablement, ensuring that teams are empowered to leverage data effectively.

  • Leadership experience in managing a team of experienced GTM and Product data analysts.

  • Ability to work closely with Product and GTM teams (PMs, AEs, CSMs) to define critical data needs, such as experimentation frameworks and end-user reporting.

Nice to haves:

  • Experience working with data engineering teams to drive scalable data solutions.

  • Familiarity with data governance frameworks and best practices.

  • Background in AI-driven analytics tools and self-serve business intelligence platforms.

Why join us?

  • We are mission-driven: we work collaboratively towards our shared vision of improving scientific communication and accelerating scientific discovery. BioRender figures have appeared in more than 54,000 publications! 

  • BioRender is loved by millions! We have a world-class NPS and a community of loyal fans and users in 200+ countries!

description:
KoboToolbox has an immediate opening for a Lead Infrastructure Engineer to fill a full-time position of approximately 35-40 hours per week, for a commitment of at least 1 year. As a member of our team, you will share in the challenge and excitement of maintaining infrastructure used by over 15,000 nonprofit organizations around the world. These humanitarian, development, and environmental organizations create data-driven change through the collection and analysis of more than 20 million surveys per month.


Only senior candidates who already have experience working on large web applications will be considered. You must have a professional history of working on systems that support substantial volumes of traffic and data.

Beyond technical acumen, we are seeking a team member who demonstrates curiosity, initiative, and a cooperative approach to problem solving and decision-making.

If you're passionate about leveraging technology to make a positive impact, we want to hear from you!


Responsibilities

  • Lead a small but growing team of infrastructure engineers (currently 1.5 FTEs besides yourself), providing direction and mentorship, with opportunities to expand the team as the organization grows.
  • Manage team schedules to maximize round-the-clock coverage, and implement an on-call rotation.
  • Develop metrics and thresholds for acceptable, marginal, and unacceptable infrastructure performance. Document both anticipatory and reactive plans to keep all services running at the acceptable level.
  • Proactively oversee large, public instances of KoboToolbox to maximize availability and performance, reduce manual labor, and control costs.
  • Supervise hosting operations for numerous smaller instances of KoboToolbox, maintaining and streamlining existing infrastructure-as-code processes.
  • Consult with self-hosting clients, guiding them through best practices and assisting them with maintenance of their own infrastructure.
  • Serve as a skilled practitioner of Linux systems administration, Docker containerization, and Kubernetes orchestration.
  • Document configuration and processes, including recurring tasks and how to assign them.
  • Work closely with the software development team to ensure smooth deployments and good performance in production, e.g. schema migrations for multi-terabyte PostgreSQL databases.
  • Assist with maintenance and improvement of development infrastructure, such as CI pipelines and automated staging deployments.
  • Act as the focal point for external auditors to ensure compliance with applicable standards such as ISO 27001.
  • Attend regular videoconference check-ins with other members of the technical team.
  • Communicate with the public in conjunction with our support staff or directly through forums, issue trackers, etc.



Requirements

Required Qualifications

  • At least 3 years of experience in infrastructure engineering, systems administration, or a related field.
  • Successful history of leading a technical team while continuing to engage with hands-on technical work.
  • Thorough grasp of the technologies underlying web applications, including networking, hardware, virtualization, operating systems, and databases.
  • Excellent verbal and written English communication skills. Friendly and effective written communication is crucial given that we are a fully remote organization.
  • Mastery of Debian-based Linux as a server operating system.
  • Experience with Terraform (or OpenTofu), Helm, Kubernetes, and Docker in a production setting.
  • Ability to write reusable scripts in Python and Bash.
  • Extensive knowledge of basic AWS services like EC2 and S3; working familiarity with others such as EKS, RDS (PostgreSQL), DocumentDB, ElasticCache, Route 53, and SES.
  • Working familiarity with Azure and Google Cloud.
  • Interest in data collection (surveying), particularly in humanitarian emergencies and other challenging contexts, and a desire to improve our platform for our users.
  • Working hours in the Eastern time zone.
  • Average availability of at least 30 hours per week, preferably 35 hours or more.


Preferred Skills

  • Strong grasp of cloud infrastructure security best practices.
  • Experience administering large PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Redis databases.
  • Good understanding of GitHub Actions and GitLab CI/CD.
  • Familiarity with XLSForm, ODK XForm, and OpenRosa.
  • Past work in a non-profit or mission-driven organization.
  • Experience with web application development in Python/Django, React, and (separately) Node.js.



Benefits

General Benefits:

  • Genuine Impact: Contribute directly to projects that affect millions globally, working with international humanitarian organizations and community-based partners in 200 countries.
  • Meaningful Work Environment: Join a team that tackles global challenges through innovative data collection tools that create lasting change.
  • Diverse Team: Be part of a globally diverse, inclusive team that values equity and inclusion across all spectrums.
  • Flexible Work Culture: Enjoy mutual flexibility, with a culture prioritizing work-life balance.
  • Professional Development: Access generous professional development opportunities.


Employee Benefits (U.S. candidates only):

  • Health & Wellness: 5 medical insurance options, dental, and vision (up to 80% premium covered), plus life insurance.
  • Financial Security: 401(k) retirement plan with 100% match up to 2%.
  • Work-Life Balance: 20 days paid time off, 10 floating holidays, unlimited sick days, and paid parental leave.

Ruby Labs operates within the CET (Central European Time) time zone. Applicants from any country are welcome to apply for the position as long as they are located within approximately ± 4 hours of CET. This ensures optimal collaboration and communication during working hours.

title: Head of Finance & Corporate
description:

Job description

Note: we describe our ideal candidate below. For an exceptional profile, this role could evolve into a Chief Financial Officer position. Please feel free to apply even if you don't think you match all items — we know these are ambitious expectations!

As Head of Finance & Corporate at Didask, you'll play a pivotal role in our next phase of growth. With over 65 team members today and plans to reach 100+ in the coming year, we're looking for someone to build and lead world-class finance and corporate functions while preserving the agility and transparency that make our culture unique.

This role embodies our values of distributed ownership, radical transparency, and data-driven decision making:

Financial Leadership

- Own our entire financial strategy, from daily operations to long-term planning

- Build and maintain transparent financial models that drive decision-making across the company

- Optimize cash management and financial operations at scale

- Lead non-dilutive fundraising initiatives (debt, public funding, grants)

- Lead relationships with investors, banks, and auditors with our signature transparency

- Structure and manage our equity programs (BSA/BSPCE) to share our success

Corporate Leadership

- Lead all legal and compliance matters, from contracts to corporate governance

- Oversee and optimize our administrative operations

- Manage our workplace strategy and facilities

- Build and maintain relationships with key external partners (law firms, accounting firms)

- Ensure our corporate structure supports our growth while staying lean and efficient

Strategic Impact

- Partner with leadership to align financial and corporate strategy with company objectives

- Champion data-driven decision making across the organization

- Build scalable foundations that support both growth and cultural values

- Be a key voice in strategic discussions, bringing both financial insight and cultural awareness

- Embody and strengthen our culture of radical transparency in all matters

Team Building

- Define and execute the long-term vision for the Finance & Corporate team

- Identify and attract key talent as we scale

- Mentor and develop team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning

- Create opportunities for internal growth and skill development

- Build a team that embodies our values of transparency and distributed ownership

Your profile

We're looking for someone with both strong financial expertise and a deep commitment to building transparent, scalable organizations. Here's what we expect:

  • Financial Excellence: You have significant experience in B2B SaaS startups, with a deep understanding of French accounting and tax regulations. You've built financial processes from the ground up, and your experience includes both equity and non-dilutive fundraising.

  • Business Acumen: Beyond pure finance, you understand B2B SaaS metrics and what drives business value. You have experience with pricing strategies, unit economics, and translating business objectives into financial planning.

  • Legal & Corporate: You have a solid understanding of French corporate law and governance. You're experienced in managing legal matters in a high-growth environment and comfortable working with external counsel.

  • Ownership Mindset: You thrive in environments where ownership is distributed and initiative is valued over hierarchy. You're comfortable making decisions with imperfect information and taking responsibility for outcomes. You believe in empowering teams through transparency rather than controlling through process.

  • Communication Master: Written communication is at the heart of our culture, and you excel at it. You can make complex financial concepts accessible to non-finance stakeholders and practice radical transparency in your communications. You build trust through clear, thoughtful documentation and embrace async-first collaboration.

  • Strategic & Hands-on: You combine big-picture thinking with a willingness to dive into the details. You're equally comfortable building financial models and optimizing day-to-day operations. You know when to delegate and when to roll up your sleeves, always keeping our mission and values in mind.

  • Growth Mindset: You're passionate about continuous learning and developing others. You see challenges as opportunities for growth and actively seek feedback. You have experience mentoring team members and creating learning opportunities.

  • Tech Savvy: While not technical, you're comfortable with modern tools and excited about using technology to automate and scale operations. You have a track record of selecting and implementing tools that drive efficiency.

Interview process

Apply by answering a few written questions about your vision and expertise. Use your own words - we value authentic communication.

If your profile catches our attention, here's what to expect:

  • Screening Interview: A first conversation to understand your background and motivations. We'll discuss your experience with transparent organizations and distributed ownership, and how you approach building scalable finance and corporate operations.

  • Take-home Exercise: A practical challenge combining financial modeling and strategic thinking. We assess both technical skills and communication clarity, with emphasis on documentation and transparency.

  • Leadership Discussion: A deeper conversation about scaling finance and corporate operations with key stakeholders. We'll explore your vision for the role and discuss concrete collaboration scenarios.

  • Final Conversation: A discussion with cofounders about vision, values, and culture. We'll align on expectations and explore how you see the future of finance and corporate functions at Didask.

Attention, nous ne pouvons à l'heure actuelle embaucher que des résidents fiscaux français.

title: Workplace Technology Engineer
description:
An Introduction to Primer

The 21st century has witnessed remarkable expansion within the payments ecosystem with the introduction of new payment services, growth in cross-border commerce, and the development of multi-payment processor payment strategies.

The bottom line is that payment is no longer just another step in the purchasing funnel but a strategic asset that can drive business growth and innovation.

Enter Primer - the world's first unified payment infrastructure, empowering businesses worldwide to unleash their payment potential. By choosing our platform, merchants can take control over their payment stack, create unique commerce experiences, accelerate their roadmap and increase payment success.

Primer's enterprise-grade infrastructure, frameworks, and tooling allow merchants to unify their disparate payment solutions and services to build optimised payment flows tailored to their unique business needs with no code or additional complexity. We strive to make something complex incredibly simple and intuitive.

Our success so far has been reflected in the trust placed in us by category leaders such as Printify, NewLook, Voi, and Dabble, who are using Primer to transform their payments into a growth lever. Moreover, the world's top investors, including Accel, Balderton, Iconiq, and Tencent, have also invested in Primer's vision to rebuild payments and commerce from the ground up.

Join us in shaping the future of payments and commerce. Let's pave the way for a world where businesses can fully realise their payment potential.

What will the role involve?

  • Design and implement workplace technology solutions tailored to the needs of our employees, focused on enhancing productivity and collaboration.

  • Supporting a broad range of SaaS services, improve device management, support access management, assist in procurement processes (reviews/configuration)

  • Lead and contribute to initiatives that improve employee productivity, working closely with cross-functional teams and internal stakeholders.

  • Maintain reliable and resilient technology services, supporting the development and upkeep of business continuity plans to ensure smooth operations during any disruptions.

  • Refine operational metrics and improve systems to monitor and enhance service health and performance.

  • Develop specialized technical expertise in workplace technology areas like collaboration and productivity tools, security, endpoint management, and end-user computing.

  • Offer expert support, guidance and troubleshooting for technical issues across our supported platforms.

  • Our current tech stack: Google Workspace, Jira, Kandji/Intune, Tines, Hofy

What are we looking for?

  • Proven experience in supporting cloud-based and SaaS platforms

  • Familiarity with major public cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).

  • Broad knowledge of IT systems, including email, file storage, networking, identity management, and device management

  • Proficiency in diagnosing and troubleshooting web-based applications.

  • Understanding of data security principles and identity management best practices.

  • Excellent documentation abilities, paired with a desire to share knowledge and mentor others.

    This position can be based ANYWHERE in European time zones, working remotely 100% of the time

    Our engineering teams work fully remotely across Europe and operate within local timezones - if you are not based in the above countries listed but would still like to apply please let us know in your application

    Unfortunately we are unable to offer VISA sponsorships or relocation packages at this time

    Our interview process

    • 30 minute call with a Talent Partner

    • 60 minute interview with an Engineering Manager

    • 60 minute final interview

What’s the culture like at Primer?

We’re building a culture where people can come and do their best work and enjoy it. We want our people to be proud of the impact that they have at Primer, and of the work that they are doing. You will be working with a team of people who are mission-driven, smart, and reflective, and who are invested in building exceptional products and delivering success for our merchants (and we also know how to have fun along the way).

We work remotely. We believe that building a successful, profitable company goes beyond proximity. We invest in our relationships with each other through great remote working practices and thoughtfully designed face-to-face time together. Our heads-together time comes in the form of workstations, our annual company retreat, and co-working space access worldwide.

Finally, let’s go ahead and say it. The work that we do is challenging. Startups are a challenge, building category defining products is a challenge. You should be prepared for a challenge at Primer. But, there’s a big difference between a challenge and a struggle. The key difference is that the right challenge comes with the right support structures, an acceptance that not everything always goes to plan, a collaborative environment, and a great team around you. It’s never a challenge that you will face alone.

Our benefits:

  • We are fully remote

  • Competitive share options

  • Uncapped holiday, with 25 days minimum to be taken

  • Co-working space access

  • Workations & company retreat

  • The best equipment for your role

  • £500 towards your home office setup

  • Generous learning budget

  • Medical insurance

  • A broad set of additional perks and benefits (depending on location)

Don’t meet every single requirement?

At Primer, we’re dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply. You may be the right candidate for this or other roles. description:
🇫🇷 La langue de travail à Didask est l'anglais et sa maîtrise est requise pour nous rejoindre. Néanmoins, nous publions l'intégralité de nos offres d'emploi en français et en anglais. 🇬🇧🇺🇸 While English is our working language at Didask and proficiency is required to join us, we publish all our job openings in both English and French. You can find all our positions on this page, along with more information about Didask, our culture and benefits.

🇫🇷 Description du poste
En tant que Prompt Engineer chez Didask, vous rejoindrez notre équipe R&D qui travaille sur des workflows IA de génération et animation de contenus pédagogiques. Votre mission : développer et optimiser des solutions basées sur l'IA générative qui rendent les expériences d'apprentissage pédagogiquement efficaces et accessibles à tous nos utilisateurs.

Vos missions seront :

  • Concevoir et mettre en œuvre des workflows d'IA générative pour la création de cours et le coaching des apprenants, tout en maintenant des standards pédagogiques élevés

  • Collaborer avec des chercheuses en sciences cognitives et des concepteur·rice·s pédagogiques pour garantir que nos solutions d'IA sont fondées sur les sciences de l'apprentissage

  • Évaluer et organiser le suivi des performances de nos workflows d'IA générative, tant du point de vue technique que pédagogique

  • Rester à la pointe de la recherche et des meilleures pratiques en IA, en identifiant les opportunités d'améliorer nos formats d'apprentissage

  • Construire et maintenir notre frameworkf IA, en mettant l'accent sur la documentation et la reproductibilité

Votre profil
Nous recherchons quelqu'un doté d'une expérience en prompt engineering avec une forte appétence pour la formation. Nous recherchons chez le·la candidat·e :

  • Compréhension approfondie des capacités et limites des LLM, avec une expérience avérée en prompt engineering et conception de workflows LLM

  • Esprit analytique et approche systématique de la résolution de problèmes

  • Excellentes capacités de communication, particulièrement à l'écrit, car la transparence et l'écrit sont au coeur de nos process

  • Intérêt sincère pour l'éducation et les sciences de l'apprentissage

  • Niveau basique en programmation (notre stack est basée sur JavaScript) et capacité à collaborer avec nos software engineers

  • Maîtrise professionnelle de l'anglais et excellentes compétences rédactionnelles en français requises

Les éléments suivants seraient un plus :

  • Formation en éducation, sciences cognitives ou domaines connexes

  • Expérience dans l'edtech ou la conception pédagogique

  • Expérience de collaboration transversale dans des contextes d'innovation

Nous rejoindre c'est :

  • contribuer à un challenge ambitieux, à l’intersection de deux sciences jeunes : l’IA générative et la recherche appliquée en psychologie expérimentale. Tout - ou presque- est à inventer !

  • adopter une approche réfléchie et éthique de l'IA, en tenant compte du bien-être des apprenants et de l'impact environnemental

  • rejoindre une équipe multi-disciplinaire qui à coeur de s’appuyer sur des méthodes de travail réellement épanouissantes, basées sur la transparence, l’autonomie et un management horizontal.

  • prendre part à un produit en phase de “scale-up” : Didask est en pleine croissance et étend les moyens mis à disposition de sa mission ainsi que les périmètres de chaque employé·e·s pour accélérer les cycles d’innovation et d’amélioration continue.

Plus sur la mission de notre équipe R&D
Le problème que nous souhaitons résoudre est le suivant : permettre à tous, même sans compétence pédagogique, de créer rapidement des formations pédagogiquement efficaces, quel que soit le sujet.

Après des années de développement de formats pédagogiques, nous nous sommes saisi des innovations en IA génératives (les Large Language Models) pour permettre :

  • de les générer automatiquement à partir des contenus de nos utilisateurs avec un minimum de reprise de leur part (par exemple en transformant automatiquement leur documentation en formation en ligne interactive)

  • d’animer des formats pédagogiques automatiquement auprès des apprenants (par exemple, en permettant à l’IA de faire des feedbacks formatifs directement aux apprenants dans certains exercices)

Notre objectif est d’augmenter l’efficacité pédagogique des formats déjà disponibles et d’en créer de nouveaux pour atteindre des objectifs que nous ne remplissons pas encore.


🇬🇧🇺🇸 Job description
As a Prompt Engineer at Didask, you'll join our R&D team to transform how organizations create and deliver effective training. Your mission: develop and optimize generative AI-powered solutions that make pedagogically sound learning experiences accessible to anyone, regardless of their teaching expertise.

This role combines technical expertise with educational impact:

  • Design and implement generative AI workflows for course generation and learner coaching, while maintaining high pedagogical standards

  • Partner with cognitive scientists and learning designers to ensure our AI solutions are grounded in learning science

  • Lead the evaluation and monitoring of our generative AI workflows' performance, from both technical and educational perspectives

  • Stay at the forefront of AI research and best practices, identifying opportunities to enhance our learning formats

  • Build and maintain our AI development framework, with a focus on documentation and replicability

Your profile

We're looking for someone who combines prompt engineering expertise with a passion for education. Here's what we expect:

  • Deep understanding of LLM capabilities and limitations, with proven experience in prompt engineering and LLM workflow design

  • Strong analytical mindset and systematic approach to problem-solving

  • Excellent communication skills, particularly in writing, as you'll work in a transparent, async-first environment

  • Genuine interest in education and learning science

  • Comfort with basic programming (our stack is JavaScript-based) and ability to collaborate with engineers

  • Professional proficiency in English and excellent writing skills in french are required,

The following would be a plus:

  • Background in education, cognitive science, or related fields

  • Experience in edtech or learning design

  • Track record of cross-functional collaboration in innovation settings

Why join our R&D team?

You'll be part of a unique mission: making effective learning accessible through the convergence of cognitive science and AI. This means:

  • Working on cutting-edge challenges where almost everything remains to be invented

title: Senior Deal Desk Analyst
description:
About BioRender:

At BioRender, our mission is to accelerate the world’s ability to learn, discover, and communicate science. We are passionate about democratizing science communication in order to accelerate scientific discovery and understanding. We're looking for amazing people to help create the world’s go-to platform where science is communicated.

We’re hiring a motivated, strategic thinker to launch BioRender’s first Deal Desk as part of our Revenue Operations team. You’ll optimize pricing and quoting processes, collaborating closely with sales, finance, and legal teams to ensure accuracy and consistency.

Ideal candidates have experience in deal management, sales operations, or finance, with a proven track record of driving impactful initiatives. You’re a self-starter who thrives in dynamic, creative environments.

This is a remote-friendly role—join us and help shape the future of science communication!

Role Overview:

We are looking for a Senior Deal Desk Analyst to join our Revenue Operations team and establish BioRender’s first Deal Desk. In this role, you’ll collaborate with sales, operations, and finance teams to optimize pricing, quoting, and deal structuring while ensuring compliance with company policies. If you thrive in cross-functional environments and have a passion for process improvement and scalability, this is the perfect opportunity to make an impact.

Our ideal fit:

  • Detail-Oriented and Data-Obsessed Mindset: You are known for your meticulous attention to detail and your ability to be process-oriented.

  • Strong Work Ethic with Prioritization Skills: You excel under pressure and can strategically manage competing priorities while maintaining transparent communication.

  • Collaborative and Cross-Functional Team Player: You build trusted relationships with diverse stakeholders and understand team dynamics and business needs. 

Your responsibilities:

  • Deal Structuring and Analysis: Collaborate with internal teams to structure and analyze deals, ensuring alignment with profitability and compliance goals.

  • Quote to Cash management: Work in CRM, ERP, CLM, and CPQ tools to streamline deal lifecycles, ensuring accurate data entry and pricing configurations.

  • Process Optimization: Develop and refine deal desk policies to enhance speed, accuracy, and scalability, leveraging automation where possible.

  • Client Invoicing Support: Partner with finance and sales team to ensure timely and accurate invoicing, addressing discrepancies and maintaining comprehensive documentation.

  • Compliance and Policy Enforcement: Ensure all deals comply with company policies and legal standards while managing required approvals.

  • Project Management: Drive cross-functional projects to implement new tools and processes while facilitating customer product activation

What You Bring to the Table:

  • 3+ years in deal desk, finance, or related roles (e.g., pricing, contract management).

  • Proficient in Salesforce; experience with CPQ systems (e.g., Salesforce CPQ, Apttus).

  • Familiar with CMS and eSignature platforms (e.g., DocuSign).

  • Experience with ERP systems (e.g., NetSuite) and CRM integration.

  • Strong technical acumen for analyzing and implementing software solutions.

  • Exceptional analytical skills for interpreting complex data.

  • Detail-oriented and thrives in fast-paced, deadline-driven environments.

  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills for cross-team collaboration.

  • Bachelor’s in Business, Finance, or related field.

  • Experience in subscription-based or SaaS models.

  • Familiarity with financial modeling and pricing strategies.

Why Join Us?

  • We are mission-driven, and work collaboratively towards our shared vision of improving scientific communication and accelerating scientific discovery: BioRender figures have appeared in more than 54,000 publications! 

  • It’s a product that users love! We have a world-class NPS and a community of loyal fans. Check out our Testimonials page to see what our customers are saying about us: https://biorender.com/testimonials/ 

  • We are in the top quartile for profitability and year-over-year revenue growth, with users in 200+ countries.

  • BioRender is an equal opportunity employer, and an inclusive hiring process and work environment is a part of our DNA. 

  • We’re remote-first and have team members across Canada and the United States. A physical office in Toronto is available, but you have the flexibility to work from anywhere. 

  • We’re backed by top investors, accelerators, and some of the most successful life science entrepreneurs and philanthropists in the world including Y Combinator, Malala Fund founders, and Fifty Years VC. 

  • We’re proud that women make up 2 of 3 co-founders, 53% of our team, and 37% of leadership. This representation continues to grow and we are hiring!

  • We are committed to building a warm, inclusive, and diverse environment. Check out how we make sure our employees come first.

    #LI-JZ1

title: FP&A Analyst
description:
Who we are:

We are a leader in fraud prevention and AML compliance. Our platform uses device intelligence, behavior biometrics, machine learning, and AI to stop fraud before it happens. Today, over 300 banks, retailers, and fintechs worldwide use Sardine to stop identity fraud, payment fraud, account takeovers, and social engineering scams. We have raised $75M from world-class investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Visa, Experian, FIS, and Google Ventures.

Our culture:

  • We have hubs in the Bay Area, NYC, Austin, and Toronto. However, we maintain a remote-first work culture. #WorkFromAnywhere

  • We hire talented, self-motivated individuals with extreme ownership and high growth orientation.

  • We value performance and not hours worked. We believe you shouldn't have to miss your family dinner, your kid's school play, friends get-together, or doctor's appointments for the sake of adhering to an arbitrary work schedule.

Additionally, the candidate will actively participate in interdepartmental projects and contribute to strategic decision-making.   • Conduct monthly forecasting

  • Exceptional attention to detail

  • Ability to utilize data to drive and communicate decisions effectively

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with business visualization tools such as Sigma or Tableau

  • SQL experience is a plus

Compensation: Base pay range of $60,000 - $80,000 + equity with tremendous upside potential + Attractive benefits

Benefits we offer:

  • Generous compensation in cash and equity

  • Early exercise for all options, including pre-vested

  • Work from anywhere: Remote-first Culture

  • Flexible paid time off, Year-end break, Self care days off

  • Health insurance, dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents - US and Canada specific

  • 4% matching in 401k / RRSP - US and Canada specific

  • MacBook Pro delivered to your door

  • One-time stipend to set up a home office — desk, chair, screen, etc.

  • Monthly meal stipend

  • Monthly social meet-up stipend

  • Annual health and wellness stipend

  • Unlimited access to an expert financial advisory

title: Sales Manager
Design Engineer
description:
LiveKit is revolutionizing the AI landscape by providing the essential network infrastructure that powers multimodal AI interfaces, enabling seamless audio and visual interactions. Founded in 2021, LiveKit has rapidly grown to support over 20,000 developers, including industry giants like OpenAI, Character AI, Spotify, and Meta. Our open-source tools facilitate real-time audio and video applications across various sectors, from customer support to autonomous farming. With a recent $22.7 million Series A funding led by Altimeter Capital, LiveKit is valued at $110 million and continues to drive innovation in AI's "nervous system," ensuring efficient and scalable data transfer to enhance AI capabilities.

Why LiveKit

While LiveKit operates as an infrastructure company, we believe that every detail matters—from backend to frontend, from a single line of code to a single pixel. Design is not just how it looks, but how all the pieces work and fit together — from a developer landing on our homepage to connecting and interacting with our APIs for the first time.

We’re in search of a Design Engineer to join our design team. The ideal candidate will have experience building highly immersive, interactive, and performant experiences for the web, and is excited about the future of realtime voice and video AI.

What you’ll do

  • Transform static designs into dynamic, interactive web experiences using core web technologies like HTML, JavaScript, CSS, SVG, and WebGL.

  • Bring designs to life with tools and frameworks such as Motion (formerly Framer Motion), Lottie, Rive, Three.js, and shaders.

  • Define and implement best practices for building, optimizing, and maintaining key features across LiveKit’s marketing web surfaces, ensuring accessibility and responsiveness across different viewport sizes.

  • Proactively identify and prioritize opportunities to improve LiveKit’s marketing surfaces, driving continuous refinement and innovation.

  • Partner closely with other designers to elevate the quality of design and user experience across all LiveKit projects.

  • Make things ✨.

Who you are

  • 5+ years of experience creating polished, interactive web experiences with a focus on both interaction and motion design.

  • Skilled in React, Tailwind, TypeScript, and Next.js, with an understanding of modern web standards including a11y.

  • A portfolio that demonstrates your ability to craft high-performance, thoughtfully designed web experiences, showcasing your interaction and motion sensibilities.

  • A strong sense of aesthetics and a keen eye for all facets of design, including user experience (UX), visual design, interaction, and motion.

  • A collaborative problem-solver who thrives in partnerships with developers, designers, and stakeholders, contributing to every phase of a project.

  • Adaptable and resourceful, with the ability to navigate the ambiguity of a fast-paced startup environment while maintaining a high-quality bar.

  • Deeply curious about technology—not just the tools of your craft, but also its evolving role in areas like AI, voice, and interactive experiences.

  • Proficient with design tools like Figma and others that help you turn ideas into reality.

Bonus

  • Experience building for OSS, developer tooling, or similar fields.

  • Experience designing new experiences based on established patterns or a design system.

If this sounds like your kind of challenge, we’d love to hear from you. Come join us to build the future of realtime voice and video AI.

Competitive salary

Generous equity package

Full healthcare benefits

Technology expense reimbursement

Virtual first environment

We do this by automating day-to-day firm operations with our Practice Automation solutions. Aiwyn is led by serial entrepreneurs with multiple exits and funded by top-tier investors (Bessemer, KKR, & Revolution). We're passionate about building a remarkable company with world-class people, processes, and technology.

To learn more, visit our website

This role:

We are looking for a Head of Revenue Operations to partner closely with our Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) to design, implement, and manage the backbone of our go-to-market engine. This is an exciting opportunity for a strategic and hands-on leader to build and own a modern Revenue Operations function at a top-quartile growth company.

As Aiwyn continues to deliver substantial year over year growth, you will play a critical role in building/scaling the revenue processes & supporting instrumentation that will help de-risk/accelerate our Go-To-Market strategy through our next stages of growth.

As the Head of Revenue Operations, you will report directly to our CRO and will be responsible for architecting, implementing, and optimizing the processes, systems, and analytics that power Aiwyn’s revenue growth.

In this role we are looking for a strategic leader who is also hands-on, diving into the data, configuration, and design alongside your team. 

This is a unique opportunity for someone who has led the build out of RevOps at similar stages of growth, or a leader that has been an owner of these functions / projects and is ready to step up into a role owning/building the RevOps department from the ground up.

If you’re passionate about the future of GTM operations—particularly with how AI is reshaping the future—and are hungry to leave your mark, we’d love to talk. 

What You'll Impact:

  • Work closely with the CRO, Head of Marketing, Head of CS, Finance team, and executive leadership to define and execute the GTM roadmap.
  • Act as a thought partner and advocate for modern revenue operations, staying ahead of industry trends and AI innovations.
  • Leverage scale-up stage start-up experience to de-risk projects and accelerate time to value, thinking about scalable solutions
  • Manage and mentor a small but growing team of operations professionals.
  • Identify and coordinate with external consultants or agencies when needed to achieve strategic goals.
  • Foster a culture of continuous learning, innovation, and excellence.
  • Lead the migration from HubSpot CRM to Salesforce.com, ensuring data integrity and minimal disruption.
  • Evaluate, implement, and manage critical tools such as Clari, sales engagement, conversational intelligence, and other GTM/RevOps technologies.
  • Oversee system integrations to create a seamless end-to-end revenue funnel, with a focus on user experience, speed, accuracy, and actionable insights.
  • Manage multiple projects with clear deliverables and develop a steady cadence of communication across all revenue stakeholders
  • Work with finance to forecast and plan for future revenue team headcount needs 
  • Ensure the organizational structure and roles are positioned to scale effectively with a focus on world-class efficiency metrics
  • Develop and optimize comp plans that support both standard SaaS subscriptions and merchant processing/payments revenue streams.
  • Partner with Finance, HR, and Sales to align compensation structures with business objectives.
  • Use data and analytics to model comp plan scenarios and measure performance against targets.
  • Lead the design and implementation of a territory framework as we shift from a geo-based approach to named accounts.
  • Collaborate with Sales Leadership to ensure territories are well-balanced and focusing capacity on the right types of selling motions
  • Continuously iterate on territory plans to maximize coverage, pipeline generation, and revenue.
  • Establish reporting and analytics frameworks to monitor the entire revenue cycle (top of funnel, pipeline, expansion, retention, and efficiency).
  • Leverage AI-driven insights and predictive analytics to forecast revenue, identify trends, and drive strategic decisions.
  • Develop and continuously refine core revenue processes (e.g., lead routing, opportunity management, pipeline inspection, forecasting, etc).
  • Collaborate with Marketing Ops and CS Ops to ensure handoffs are seamless and client touchpoints are well-orchestrated.

    • What You'll Bring From Past Experience:

  • 8+ years in Revenue Operations, Sales Operations, or related roles within a scale-up B2B SaaS environment
  • 2+ years of leadership experience building/leading/developing a team
  • Demonstrated success in building or significantly influencing the scale up of RevOps processes and systems.
  • Familiarity with payment processing/merchant services revenue models is highly preferred
  • Hands-on experience with Salesforce.com administration and implementation.
  • Direct experience migrating from one CRM to another (HubSpot to Salesforce.com is a plus).
  • Proficiency with a modern GTM tech stack (e.g. Clari, Conversation intelligence, Sales Engagement, Sales Enablement, BI - Looker, etc) and data sources (LSN, ZoomInfo, 6sense, etc) 
  • Expert user of cross functional workforce management tools such as Monday.com, Asana, etc. 
  • Expert Excel/Google Sheets skills
  • Ability to set the strategy but also get in the weeds—“hands on keyboard” with data, tools, and process documentation.
  • Proven track record of building scalable processes in a high-growth environment.
  • Exceptional cross functional program management skills 
  • A builder mindset: excited about creating a function from scratch and seeing it scale.

  • Compensation & Benefits: Highly competitive salary, equity, and benefits, reflecting our commitment to attracting and retaining the very best talent in the world

    • Benefits and Perks:

  • The big-picture value proposition of this role is simple: join us, and you'll be paid competitively to have freedom in solving worthwhile, challenging problems alongside other A-players at a fast growing SaaS startup led by an experienced and successful co-founding team with industry experience.

title: Senior Front-end Engineer (Marketing Hub / CRM)
Support Engineer (Americas)
description:
Supabase is an open-source database platform built by developers for developers. Supabase adds auth, realtime, storage, restful APIs, and edge functions to Postgres.

We are seeking Support Engineers to provide world-class developer support for anyone experiencing issues or seeking guidance when using Supabase. The support team is globally distributed with a strong focus on minimizing time to fix, and works closely with the product engineering and growth teams.

You will:

  • Provide initial and timely responses to all support cases for a variety of topics, from billing or pre-sales requests to optimization or implementation questions.

  • Triage support cases including directing users to previous answers, code examples, documentation, or escalating to specific technical or business team members.

  • Monitor multiple feedback channels, e.g. Github Issues & Discussions (check them here: https://github.com/supabase/supabase/issues).

  • Identify where internal tooling might be developed or obtained to improve support efficiency.

  • Reproduce issues, create test cases and improve test coverage, if you have experience with testing.

You are:

  • Experienced in customer support, with 3+ years of experience providing developer support to technical customers.

  • Proficient in SQL (ideally PostgreSQL). You feel comfortable with complex SQL queries. If you have a database administration experience, it’s a plus.

  • Excellent communication skills and fluency in English.

  • Skilled in using Linux/Unix operating systems and the command line.

  • Experienced working with GitHub Issues and Discussions.

  • Bonus points if you're familiar with popular JavaScript frameworks like React, Vue, and Svelte and have some experience with Node.js.

  • Having a degree in Computer Science is a plus too.

Timezones & Logistics

  • It’s a full-time position with a required location in North American time zones (we don’t believe in sustainability of overnight shifts).

We offer

  • 100% remote work. No location-based adjustment to your salary.

  • Autonomous work. We work collaboratively on projects, but you set your own pace.

  • Health, Vision and Dental benefits. Supabase covers 100% of the cost for employees and 80% for dependents

  • Tech Allowance for any office setup you need

  • Annual Education Allowance

  • Annually run off-sites.

About the team

  • We're a startup. It's unstructured.

  • Collectively founded more than 30 startups.

  • Globally distributed team with more than 30 different nationalities.

  • We deeply believe in the efficacy of collaborative open source. We support existing communities and tools, rather than building "yet another xx".

  • We "dogfood" everything. If you use it in your project, we use it in Supabase.

Process

  • The entire process is fully remote and all communication will happen over email or via video chat.

  • Once you've submitted your application, the team will review your submission and may reach out for a short screening interview over a video call.

  • If you pass the screen you will be invited to up to four follow-up interviews.

  • The calls:

    • usually take between 20-45 minutes each depending on the interviewer.

    • most of the time, are all 1:1.

    • will be with the founders, a member of either the growth or engineering team (depending on the role) and usually one other person from your immediate team or function.

  • Once the interviews are over, the team will meet to discuss several roles and candidates and may:

    • ask one or two follow-up questions over email or a quick call.

    • go directly to making an offer.
